title: Fastest way to level up your Steam Account?

json.text:
There's definitely cheaper methods of leveling
up your steam account.

But this is actually a pretty neat way of
doing it that I haven't seen before.

Hey guys, salut mes amis och hall√• gubbar,
Maxim here.

Let me just begin and say that I wasn't sponsored
by this service that I'm going to show you guys.

I was looking for something like this after
wanting to level up my Steam Account from

a 100 to 130, because I wanted the yellow
badge on my Steam Profile.

I was able to do it in less than 30 minutes,
but I obviously had to pay.

So this is SteamLevels, and no this is not
my site, funny how I have to say that.
You probably know about Steam Bots already, that you can use them to trade keys and trading cards right?

Well, this is pretty much the same thing,
but the main difference being, you don't have

to add any Bots, you can do everything from
the site.

I decided to test the service out with my
account, so here's how I did it.

First you need to sign in through Steam so
the site can find your Steam Level, your progress
and your current badges.
Next step is to update your Trade URL.

So it found my current level and I want my
new level to be 130.

After entering the new level, it will list
my new rewards, but most importantly it will

offer different methods of paying to get to
that level.

You can use CS:GO keys if you want, however,
if you buy keys in-game or through the market

you will have to wait one week before you
can use them.

For this I've decided to trade some of my
skins.

Here you can decide what skins you want to
select and you can also choose multiple skins.

When I'm done I just click on Trade and it
will send me a Trade Offer when it's ready.

After about 7 to 8 minutes I got this huge
trade offer, and after everything was loaded
I confirmed the trade.

You don't need to own the games to craft the
trading cards that you will get, and it will

only pick cards that you haven't already crafted
from your account.

I got so many cards at once that Steam was
having an issue loading all of them, I had

to wait for just a few more minutes until
I could see them in my inventory.

When that was done I clicked here to get a
Crafting Script.

This is a script for Tampermonkey which is
an extension if you're using Chrome, or Greasemonkey

if you're using Firefox and it's highly recommended
for speeding up the crafting process.

Since I'm using Chrome I needed to install
Tampermonkey, when that was done I clicked

on the link to install the script, and after
that I could find my new button under the
badges page.

Here's all settings that you can play around
with if you want, I'm just going to keep it
as it is.
When you're ready click on AutoCraft all badges.
Now all you need to do is wait for it to finish.
20 minutes later I was level 130.

So I really like this service, props to the
developers for making it so user-friendly,

I can definitely recommend it to other people
who want to level up their account fast.
They also have a Steam Group for more information.

If you're looking for probably the cheapest
solution, you can always go to this page called

steam.tools, sign in through Steam, make sure
you click on "not owned games", and then you
can sort by set price.

You can now click on the B symbol for the
first game that pops up and buy the cards
from there.

This was the method that I used before, and
it's still very useful.
Let me know what you think about the site, and if you want obviously, you can recommend other methods below.
That's it anyways, hope you enjoyed the video, I'll see you guys in the next one, and go bananas!
